cab.content: This Document is tne frreperty of His Britannic Majesty's government military Secret, 901From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of Stale for India,12LhJuhjim. (Repeated Constantinople, No. 59718.) (Received 13th.)9408. 11th July. Major-General Malleson wires 10th July :-" 1. Direct touch with Askabad still broken. Town has apparently now been occupied by Bolshevik troops." 2. Bajgivran reports that Bolshevik field works were seen by refugees yesterday at Malakhan, which is 10 miles from Askabad on the main N.E. road." 2 (sic). As no Bolsheviks have entered Daragaz, I have sent one squadron 28th Cavalry from Imam Quli to Bajgivran as support to Khorassan levies there, and to help Persian authorities in disarmament of armed gangs of refugees." B.M.A. Charjui agent wrote on 20th June that 800 Bolshevik troops have passed through Merv."
